good news, not everyone is a bad person. there are plenty of people that take the interests of others over their own interests, with no reasons as to why.

bad news, I have a distinct feeling you are not among them, nor have you personally managed to identify one.

I've heard that you only get the "thanks to your report this player has been punished" message only if your report was the one that finally pushed them over the line. If you report a player for being toxic, at the very least that report is going to be kept in their history as damning evidence when they come to be reported again and again in the future.

Well the only time I saw someone got punished, me and the other player who reported him both got the message he had been punished. This guy was a really extreme case though. He kept getting mad at our teammates for feeding (except me by some miracle idk), even though he wasn't doing so well himself. He threatened to afk multiple times, then actually did for about 3 minutes and came right back only to start flaming again. Even when I looked into his match history after the fact he had two leaves on record (which is probably why he came back into our game, probably got some message that he'd left too many games recently). If he hadn't been punished, I would've known the system was a complete waste of time.
Because only the most recent game where reports where made are the reporters notified i believe.... so if they are REALLY bad....

Supposedly your reports begin to get disregarded if you report people who aren't displaying punishable behavior. I try to only report people who are seriously toxic rather than everyone who is the slightest bit moody.

i've gotten it twice in a row for the same player it might still be in my match history it was a camille player in nexus siege that was inting behind all their turrets in their base, that and calling us down-syndrome fa****s didn't help her cause either very next game she inted and said lag the whole game gause we had a mf with lag the previous game.
I get one a week I think, but I don't report people who just have bad games, just those who are very toxic.

Yep, you're effectively contributing to making this community worse. Reports are there to stop people from being harmful, not to bully them for fun. You make it sound like people genuinely just report people because they want them to suffer, but that's not true. People want to prevent other people's suffering by circling the douchebags out and getting them banned.

I'm probably evil but I do like the side-effect of the really toxic ones suffering.

For the lesser cases, no, I want them to learn that their behaviour is unacceptable and to act differently in the future.  If they can then later share that insight with others, all the better.
